subject: Management
title: Satisficing vs Maximizing
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Satisficing vs Maximizing.

hook.text: A manager compared 47 vendors for a $500 purchase. It took three weeks.

buildup.text: Maximizers search for the best option. Under pressure, that search never ends.

discovery.text: Herbert Simon coined satisficing: pick the first option that meets your minimum criteria.

twist.text: Satisficing isn't settling. It's recognizing that good enough now beats perfect too late.

climax.text: Define your criteria upfront. When something meets them, decide. Move on.

punchline.text: Good enough now beats perfect never.

quiz.question: What is satisficing?
options: Choosing the first option that meets minimum criteria
Always selecting the cheapest available option
Spending extra time to find the absolute best choice
